channel.title: Steam Holiday Extravaganza
channel.description:
Didn't see a thread for this and figured it should have its own thread.
So once again we get to Steam's holiday sale. And this time they introduce coupons, which are tradable. This thread can be used to list which coupons you have and trade with other forum members, which I think will be useful.
So right now I have these coupons: 50% off any Valve game 50% off some Serious Sam HD Second Encounter

item.title: Steam Holiday Extravaganza
item.dc:creator: DiePoente
item.description:
Mont_Blanc:

How could you run out of virtual coupons ? Those greedy mothafcka :meh:

I think the other companies just didn’t want to give any more. And hey, we should be actually happy that they are actually giving out some for free. They didn’t take us anything away, did they?

Read full topic

item.title: Steam Holiday Extravaganza

item.description:
has anyone got a spare Modern Warfare (dont care which one) or coupon for it?

item.title: Steam Holiday Extravaganza
item.dc:creator: The_Laughing_Man
item.description:
sudpuzzer:

Here’s what I have up for grabs:

  • A copy of HL2 (for some poor unfortunate who hasn’t been blessed with it’s grace)
  • 25% Valve
  • 50% Penny Arcade Adventures
  • 50% Section 8: Prejudice

I’d be interested in the hl2 coupon, i’d like to gift it to a friend, if no one here in the forum want it you can look at my inventory for any coupons if you want, or the game “two worlds” if it’s of your interest

Read full topic

item.title: Steam Holiday Extravaganza
item.dc:creator: DiePoente
item.description:
Mont_Blanc:

Everybody got valve coupons. Looks like Valve is desperate

Nope. They ran out of other coupons so only Valve coupons were left at the end of the sales. One of Valve’s developers told that in the steam forums.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam Holiday Extravaganza
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
-25% City Interactive and -25% Atari for your 33% Codemasters?

I feel like I’m back in grade school trading Pokémon cards.

item.title: Steam Holiday Extravaganza
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
I gave away my Homefront coupon today, but I still have the rest that I’m not gonna use.

50% Valve
33% Deep Silver (re: Dead Island)
50% Tales of Monkey Island
50% Zombie Driver (I may use this one, I had no idea this game existed and am curious now)

item.title: Steam Holiday Extravaganza
item.dc:creator: FERGUS
item.description:
I used my 10% off 2K and bought “The Misadventures of P.B. Winterbottom”. I thought i should use atleast one of my coupons and I did choose the 2K one because it was the only on which wasn’t for a specific game and wasn’t Valve.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam Holiday Extravaganza
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
CTID:

On the other hand that might mean that other publishers determined how many coupons were allowed to be given out. I’m sure Valve doesn’t mind discounting their games more than other publishers care about their games being discounted.

This is what I figured it was. Especially considering they even said a day before the event ended that they ran out of 3rd party coupons.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam Holiday Extravaganza
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
I saw this on Reddit and thought it was amazing:

During the Holiday sales:

  • 10% sale = 35% increase in sales (real dollars, not units shipped)
  • 25% sale = 245% increase in sales
  • 50% sale = 320% increase in sales
  • 75% sale = 1470% increase in sales

At 75% off, they are making 15% more money than they were at full price.

https://www.g4tv.com/thefeed/blog/post/693342/live-blog-dice-2009-keynote-gabe-newell-valve-software/

And here’s a chart for the game Xotic

Read full topic
